sentences.en: ...the struggle to save America's Civil War battlefields.
Both my travelling companion and I wanted to go to Waterloo — that historic battlefield.
sentences.cn: 我的旅游伙伴和我都想去滑铁卢——那个历史上著名的战场.

sentences.en: But bloodshed on the battlefield remains the decisive thing in wars.
sentences.cn: 但战场上的浴血奋战仍然是决定战争胜负的事情.

sentences.en: He showed valour and skill on the battlefield.
sentences.cn: 他在战场上显得骁勇善战.

sentences.en: Her son died on the battlefield.
New guns firing high explosive shells were incorporated into the battlefield.
sentences.cn: 发射高爆弹的新型大炮在战场上得到了使用。

sentences.en: She disguised herself as a man so she could fight on the battlefield.
sentences.cn: 她女扮男装，这样就可以上战场了。

sentences.en: The ancient Rome battlefield was a scene of great carnage.
sentences.cn: 古罗马战场曾尸横遍地.

sentences.en: The battlefield flowed with rivers of blood.
The battlefield was a scene of appalling bloodshed.
sentences.cn: 战场上一片恐怖的屠杀景象.

sentences.en: The battlefield was full of craters made by exploding shells.
The helicopters are designed to quickly lift soldiers and equipment to the battlefield.
sentences.cn: 这些直升机是为将士兵和装备快速空运到战场上而设计的。

sentences.en: The two opposing armies faced each other across the battlefield.
sentences.cn: 敌对两军在战场上严阵对峙。

sentences.en: Those who escaped from the battlefield were hunted down.
sentences.cn: 那些从战场上逃跑的人被四处追抄.

sentences.en: Thunder boomed like battlefield cannons over Crooked Mountain.
sentences.cn: 雷声像战场上的炮声一样响彻克鲁克德山。

trans.tran_en: a place where a battle is being fought or has been fought
